description.p: Barbarians who follow the Path of the Reaver embrace the pain of battle, turning suffering into power. They revel in the chaos of combat, growing stronger as their health wanes and draining vitality from their enemies to sustain their fury.

You channel the raw ferocity of battle, drawing power from spilled blood to fuel your rage and relentless assaults. This primal connection to life’s essence allows you to unleash devastating attacks while feeding off the vitality of those around you.
Blood Frenzy While raging, you gain your Constitution modifier to attack rolls. When your hit points fall below half of your maximum, you gain both your Constitution modifier and half your Barbarian level to attack and damage rolls.. However, at the start of each of your turns while raging, you take damage equal to your Barbarian level. This damage ignores resistance and immunity. However, when your rage ends, you take 1d6 damage for each time you benefited from this feature during the rage. This damage ignores resistance and immunity.
Devour While raging, you can use a bonus action to drain vitality from a creature within 10 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or take necrotic damage equal to 1d8 + your Constitution modifier. You regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.

Additionally, if your current hit points are below half your maximum, you gain a bonus of +{{blood frenzy:att low hp}} to attack and damage rolls. However, when your rage ends, you take 1d6 damage for each time you benefited from this feature during the rage. This damage ignores resistance and immunity.

description.p: As a bonus action, you can activate a 10-foot aura of pain around you for 1 minute. Creatures within the aura (excluding you) take damage equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum 1) at the start of their turns. While the aura is active, you gain resistance to psychic damage. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

description.p: When a creature dies within 10 feet of you while you are raging, the thrill of death invigorates you. As a Reaction you can can suck the remaining life from a creature, You gain temporary hit points equal to your Barbarian level, and until the end of your next turn, your melee weapon attacks deal an additional 1d6 damage. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: As a Reaction you can can suck the remaining life from a creature, You gain {{deaths fervour:hp}} temporary hit points, and until the end of your next turn while the temporary hit points are not 0, your melee weapon attacks deal an additional 1d6 damage.

description.p: Your lust for battle becomes all-consuming. While raging and below half your hit points (rounded down), you gain the following benefits: You have advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls. Your melee weapon attacks deal an additional 1d10 damage. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points, you can immediately make one melee weapon attack as a bonus action.
